descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of ratio concepts.
Struggles to define a ratio or identify its components.
Can define a ratio but struggles to apply it in simple scenarios.
Understands the basic concept of a ratio and can apply it to solve simple problems with prompting.
Demonstrates a solid understanding of ratio concepts and can apply them to solve a variety of problems. Can explain the relationship between two quantities using ratio language.

Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of ratio concepts and can apply them to complex problems. Can clearly and accurately explain ratio relationships using precise language and different representations (e.g., fractions, decimals, percentages).
Unable to use ratio language to describe relationships between quantities.
Uses inaccurate or inappropriate language when describing ratios.
Uses basic ratio language but struggles with more complex descriptions.
Can use ratio language to describe simple relationships between quantities with occasional errors.
Consistently uses accurate and appropriate ratio language to describe relationships between quantities in a variety of contexts.
Uses sophisticated and precise ratio language to effectively communicate complex ratio relationships. Can adapt language to suit different audiences and purposes.
Unable to solve problems involving ratios.
Struggles to set up and solve even simple ratio problems.
Can solve simple ratio problems with significant guidance.
Can solve routine ratio problems independently but struggles with non-routine problems.
Can solve a variety of ratio problems, including some non-routine problems. Shows clear steps in the problem-solving process.
Can solve complex and non-routine ratio problems accurately and efficiently. Demonstrates a deep understanding of proportional reasoning and can apply it to real-world situations.
